reviews.review: what the hell does this game have to do with bioshock? it feels like a new game carrying none of the atmosphere, meaning and half of the gameplay for double the price. this game has nothing to do with the originals and fails to be a reboot 4/10.
Didn't expect to like this game but damn. This is one of the story rich game that I have ever played in my life! I really recommend this game!

one of the best single-player looter shooter game. You should play this game at least once and have experience of it because it is so awesome. And you can get this game for pretty cheap on the sale !!

I've played through it a few times and it's great every time. I already look forward to firing it up again in a year or two.

Honestly, I'm very upset that I never played this game earlier. Nearly ten years have passed since this game was made, and I JUST NOW played it. It was a beautiful, confusing, fantastic story. The gameplay itself is great, however I did find it extraordinarily easy, despite having it on "Hard" and not being especially skilled at FPS's. That in no way detracts from the emotions that I felt playing this game, nor how enjoyable it was. Quite the twisting and turning journey, but the best ones always are - I highly recommend everyone play this at least once, on whatever console you can.

Gameplay's good, I saw no bugs or glitches in my playthrough, and the story? Well... I'ts just... Breathtaking.

This game gets a 10/10 from me.

Good story and pretty solid game.

I really enjoyed Bioshock, the base game. Great ideas all coming together, the powers, the world, the villian, the story. This Bioshock however improved in areas, The world looked amazing, bright is what they were going after and they got it. The powers/gameplay improved different actions and more guns, easy to use and good diversity. I really enjoyed the addition of the companion but in hard mode she is still helping you out giving you salts, money and aid (a double edged sword there, so no complaints). The story and villain however, did not improve, the first game, had a bit of a psychology thrill with philosophical questions. This game didn't, The motivations, of the villain doesn't make sense and after finishing the game, finding out the answers to the most important questions of the game, still doesn't make sense, what debt and others still are unanswered (now i am fine with not answering every question, but if you give backstory and start to answer questions which aren't necessary and i believe i have have the right to know the answers so some other minor but still major plot questions)? I loved playing this game, great mechanics but the story lacklustre. The best games, have stories which even though all the decisions you as the player make are already written you can't change that, make you feel like you are making those decisions. Making you an active participant in the game. This game however punishes that. If you came for good gameplay, i would recommend, if you came for a rich story and good(satisfying) ending i would say play a different game.

This game is amazing. A true storytelling masterpiece mixed in with solid and truly fun gameplay. I put off playing this game for years after my cousin and uncle recommended it to me, and now I realize that that was years wasted without experiencing this beauty. I think this game legitimately made my life better.

From a writing perspective, this game hits all the marks. Well developed characters, an organic plot, and an interesting setting. You feel like you're a part of the story instead of just being told it. From a gameplay perspective, similar results as the game excels there as well. The controls are a bit wonky, but a couple remaps and you feel completely in control with a variety of ways to approach each situation. The game also appeals to countless playstyles. And my experience, well, I still think about it even months after it happened.

Never played a Bioshock game. I finally take the plunge. I experience Columbia. I tear through the story. I roll credits after 3 days of plowing through this game, only taking breaks for basic life interactions and to walk out into the living room where the unfortunate people I live with gape in confusion as I pace around with my hands on my head in a total trance, not fully having left the world that I submerged myself in. No, I was not prepared for the onslaught of things that a video game would do to me or make me feel. I will say no more in fear of affecting your own experience, as this game is truly something you have to experience for yourself. So go do so.

I've finally gotten through this game and Burial at Sea. To be honest, the gameplay is not as good as I remember it on release. Maybe it's the switch from console to pc or maybe it's just the fact that I've played newer more fluid game since but that was a little disapointing. It's also not worth playing the game on hard since it turns most specials into bullet sponges and they will just deplete your ammo and salt.

HOWEVER

This game, like the rest of the Bioshock Franchise, is a masterpiece in storytelling. The buildup is pretty slow but it gets wild toward the end in expected and unexpected ways. If, like me, you managed to go this long without getting the end spoiled, go in blind and enjoy the ride. Also, pick up Burial at Sea since it expands on Infinite in an impressive way. (You might want to play 1 & 2 first because BaS has a lot of call backs to those.)

Grafika fenomenalna (szczegÃ³lnie jak na tamte czasy), bogata historia Å›wiata jak i fabuÅ‚a, kozackie mechaniki walki (gÅ‚Ã³wnie za sprawÄ… "supermocy"). This game makes me want to press F12 every 10 seconds. The visuals and graphics are absolutely stunning. The game reminds me a lot of TLOU, with the relationship between Joel and Ellie, similar to that of Booker and Elizabeth. BioShock Infinite does an amazing job at bringing Booker and Elizabeth to life.

Edit: Upon completing the game and (more or less) understanding the deepest plot for a video game I have ever experienced, I have to say that this is now  one of my favourite games of all time. The story alone is so captivating, it makes the game worth it at full price. Gameplay is entertaining and uniquely special from any other first-person shooter out there. This game will be a classic for many years to come.

I simply cannot recommend this game enough. It's a masterpiece. 11/10.
